the contribution of capital deepening by contrast initially increased during the recession as the large drop in total hours worked led to a sharp rise in the amount of capital per hour

the role of the euro areas trading partners in global value chains affects the way output shocks are transmitted to the euro area
first the bilateral trade impact on the euro area following a foreign output shock would be through direct exports to the trading partner
second there would be an echo trade impact which would depend on how other trading partners are impacted and change their demand for euro area exports
third there would be an additional impact via trade in global value chains as a share of euro area exports is indirect exports through a trading partner to the final destination
the final impact on the euro area following an output shock would depend on the combined effect of these different trade channels
